context: Other major newspapers include Miami Today, headquartered in <a1_0><b6_0>Brickell<b6_0/><a1_0/>, Miami New Times, headquartered in <a0_0><b5_0>Midtown<b5_0/><a0_0/>, Miami Sun Post, South Florida Business Journal, Miami Times, and Biscayne Boulevard Times. An additional Spanish-language newspapers, Diario Las Americas also serve Miami. The Miami Herald is Miami's primary newspaper with over <b8_0>a <a2_0>million<b8_0/><a2_0/> readers and is headquartered in Downtown in Herald Plaza. Several other student newspapers from the local universities, such as the oldest, the University of Miami's The Miami Hurricane, <a3_0><b7_0>Florida International<a3_0/> University<b7_0/>'s The Beacon, Miami-Dade College's The Metropolis, Barry University's <a4_0><b9_0>The Buccaneer<b9_0/><a4_0/>, amongst others. Many neighborhoods and neighboring areas also have their own local newspapers such as the Aventura News, Coral Gables Tribune, Biscayne Bay Tribune, and the Palmetto Bay News.
